issue.title: mysql: Unable to set sysvar_binlog_row_value_options to empty string

labels.name: awaiting-affected-resources
labels.description: Please Provide the affected resource name in description. ex. Affected resource - oci_core_instance

issue.body:
The mysql dynamic variable `sysvar_binlog_row_value_options` can be empty string or PARTIAL_JSON. According to MySQL official doc, this value defaults to empty. But on Oracle system, it defaults to PARTIAL_JSON.

If we want to set empty string for this variable, either with empty string ("") or null value (null) the terraform provider will always result in new configuration for database server with sysvar_binlog_row_value_options reset to PARTIAL_JSON.

issue.title: 5.17.0 and 5.18.0 documentation page is missing oci_osmanagement_managed_instance from navigation tree

labels.name: In-Progress
labels.description: Terraform Team is working on the reproduce & fix

issue.body:
<!---
Before filing a bug report, see if your issue is already covered in the [troubleshooting guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html)

Please note the following times when an issue is likely outside of the OCI provider.
This could be either due to issues in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service or the Terraform core.

Examples of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service issues:
* You receive an error with HTTP status code such as 500
* One of your resources timed out while waiting to reach a specific state, even after increasing your operation timeout value

If you are running into one of the above scenarios, we recommend contacting Oracle support at https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/GSG/Tasks/contactingsupport.htm


Examples of Terraform core issues:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues
* [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues
* [Provisioner](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/index.html) issues
* [Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/) issues
* Spans resources across multiple providers

If you are running into a Terraform core issue, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead.
--->

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Terraform Version and Provider Version
Terraform v1.5.3
on darwin_amd64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/oracle/oci v5.17.0

<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). 
If you are using a local copy of the Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Provider, run the plugin directly to get the version: `<path-to-plugin>/terraform-provider-oci`
If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->

### Affected Resource(s)
affected_resources = oci_osmanagement_managed_instance, oci_osmanagement_managed_instance_group, oci_osmanagement_managed_instance_management, oci_osmanagement_software_source
<!--- Please list the affected resources and data sources. For example, "oci_core_vcn". --->


### Terraform Configuration Files

<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```hcl
# Copy-paste your Terraform configurations here - for large Terraform configs,
# please use a service like Dropbox and share a link to the ZIP file. 
# Please remove any sensitive information from configuration files before sharing them. 
```

### Debug Output

<!---
Please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the complete debug output. Please do NOT paste the debug output in the issue; just paste a link to the Gist.

To obtain the debug output, see the [Verbose logging for OCI Terraform Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html#verbose-logging-for-oci-terraform-provider).

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->

### Panic Output

<!--- 
If Terraform produced a panic, please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the output of the `crash.log`. 

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->

### Expected Behavior
Documentation should have oci_osmanagement_managed_instance (and other osmanagement resources) in navigation tree.
<!--- What should have happened? --->

### Actual Behavior
Documentation does not have oci_osmanagement_managed_instance (and other osmanagement resources) in navigation tree.

<!--- What actually happened? --->

### Steps to Reproduce
I can browse directly to the resource here https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/resources/osmanagement_managed_instance

. . . but I cannot find it in the navigation tree. See here where it is present in 5.16.0 version https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/5.16.0/docs/data-sources/osmanagement_managed_instance
![image](https://github.com/oracle/terraform-provider-oci/assets/590333/94bbd4b0-f6b8-414a-b33d-91158380a0d3)

Notice is missing from navigation tree here in 5.18.0 (and 5.17.0) versions https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/5.18.0/docs/data-sources/osmanagement_managed_instance
![image](https://github.com/oracle/terraform-provider-oci/assets/590333/a997c659-6e95-4214-93cc-6eec76f85a07)

<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->

### Important Factoids

<!--- Is there anything atypical about your environment that we should know? For example: Is the issue specific to a region? --->

### References

<!---
Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests

Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor documentation? For example:

comment.body: Thank you for reporting the issue. We have raised an internal ticket to track this. Our service engineers will get back to you.

issue.title: mysql: Unable to set sysvar_binlog_row_value_options to empty string
issue.body:
The mysql dynamic variable `sysvar_binlog_row_value_options` can be empty string or PARTIAL_JSON. According to MySQL official doc, this value defaults to empty. But on Oracle system, it defaults to PARTIAL_JSON.

If we want to set empty string for this variable, either with empty string ("") or null value (null) the terraform provider will always result in new configuration for database server with sysvar_binlog_row_value_options reset to PARTIAL_JSON.

comment.body:
Thank you for reporting the issue. We observed the affected resources are not provided in the description or it's incorrect. We request you to add it in issue description as mentioned in below format.
Example: affected_resources = oci_core_instance , oci_core_instances
 
If it's not related to any particular resource then mention affected resource as terraform.
Example: affected_resources = terraform
 
As this works through automation, request you to follow exact syntax.

issue.title: OCI Redis Terraform
issue.body:
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Description

Addition of new resources to manage Redis clusters in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Cache with Redis. Currently, there is only two data sources available (oci_redis_redis_cluster; oci_redis_redis_clusters).

### New or Affected Resource(s)

resource:  oci_redis_redis_cluster (suggested name)

### Potential Terraform Configuration
```hcl
resource "oci_redis_redis_cluster" "test_redis_cluster" {
  compartment_id = var.compartment_ocid
  display_name = var.redis_cluster_display_name
  node_count = 1
  // or other required configurations for a Redis cluster in OCI.
}
```

### References

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_cluster
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_clusters
https://www.oracle.com/cloud/redis/

comment.body:
The documentation does exists: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/resources/redis_redis_cluster
But it's not searchable or cannot be discovered.
This must be a doc bug.

release.name: v5.18.0
release.body:
## 5.18.0 (October 24, 2023)

### Added
- Support for Add MR table feature into Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud
- Support for DST Timezone and non-Rolling updates for ADBD and ADBDCC
- Support for Application Dependency Management (ADM) Remediation
- Support for filter alarms by dimension
### Bug Fix
- adding static drgrouterule using core_drg_route_table_route_rule_resource makes calls to list dynamic route rules
release.short_description_html:
5.18.0 (October 24, 2023)

Added

  • Support for Add MR table feature into Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud
  • Support for DST Timezone and non-Rolling updates for ADBD and ADBDCC
  • Support for Application Depen…

issue.title: OCI Redis Terraform
issue.body:
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Description

Addition of new resources to manage Redis clusters in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Cache with Redis. Currently, there is only two data sources available (oci_redis_redis_cluster; oci_redis_redis_clusters).

### New or Affected Resource(s)

resource:  oci_redis_redis_cluster (suggested name)

### Potential Terraform Configuration
```hcl
resource "oci_redis_redis_cluster" "test_redis_cluster" {
  compartment_id = var.compartment_ocid
  display_name = var.redis_cluster_display_name
  node_count = 1
  // or other required configurations for a Redis cluster in OCI.
}
```

### References

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_cluster
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_clusters
https://www.oracle.com/cloud/redis/

comment.body:
I do notice as well the resource is not in the documentation and only data sources are listed, but it is indeed in the example at: https://github.com/oracle/terraform-provider-oci/blob/d25a2316e70c22806dde09112413dcb8e878229d/examples/redis/redis_cluster/main.tf#L77

```
resource "oci_redis_redis_cluster" "test_redis_cluster" {
```

I tested using the `oci` provider 5.17 and the resource is a valid one.
All in all, it seems the miss is on the documentation listed on the Terraform site, as the documentation exists in the GitHub at: https://github.com/oracle/terraform-provider-oci/blob/d25a2316e70c22806dde09112413dcb8e878229d/website/docs/r/redis_redis_cluster.html.markdown

commits.message: Bug Fix - adding static drgrouterule using core_drg_route_table_route_rule_resource makes calls to list dynamic route rules
Added - Support for filter alarms by dimension
Added - Support for Application Dependency Management (ADM) Remediation
Added - Support for DST Timezone and non-Rolling updates for ADBD and ADBDCC
Added - Support for Add MR table feature into Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud
Vendored - oci-go-sdk v65.51.0 changes for existing & new services
Finalize changelog and release for version v5.18.0
Vendored - oci-go-sdk for release version v65
Added - README.md of service examples with magic button

Merge pull request #1980 from oracle/release_gh

Releasing version 5.18.0

issue.title: oci_containerengine_node_pool initial_node_labels not working

labels.name: In-Progress
labels.description: Terraform Team is working on the reproduce & fix

issue.body:
<!---
Before filing a bug report, see if your issue is already covered in the [troubleshooting guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html)

Please note the following times when an issue is likely outside of the OCI provider.
This could be either due to issues in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service or the Terraform core.

Examples of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service issues:
* You receive an error with HTTP status code such as 500
* One of your resources timed out while waiting to reach a specific state, even after increasing your operation timeout value

If you are running into one of the above scenarios, we recommend contacting Oracle support at https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/GSG/Tasks/contactingsupport.htm


Examples of Terraform core issues:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues
* [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues
* [Provisioner](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/index.html) issues
* [Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/) issues
* Spans resources across multiple providers

If you are running into a Terraform core issue, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead.
--->

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Terraform Version and Provider Version
Terraform v1.5.7
on linux_amd64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/oci v5.14.0
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/vault v3.20.1

<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). 
If you are using a local copy of the Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Provider, run the plugin directly to get the version: `<path-to-plugin>/terraform-provider-oci`
If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->

### Affected Resource(s)

<!--- Please list the affected resources and data sources. For example, "oci_core_vcn". --->
oci_containerengine_node_pool

### Terraform Configuration Files

<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```hcl
# Copy-paste your Terraform configurations here - for large Terraform configs,
# please use a service like Dropbox and share a link to the ZIP file. 
# Please remove any sensitive information from configuration files before sharing them. 
```
resource "oci_containerengine_node_pool" "oke-node-pool" {
    initial_node_labels {
        app = "primion"
        env = "primion-dev"
    } 
}

### Debug Output

<!---
Please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the complete debug output. Please do NOT paste the debug output in the issue; just paste a link to the Gist.

To obtain the debug output, see the [Verbose logging for OCI Terraform Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html#verbose-logging-for-oci-terraform-provider).

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->
╷
│ Error: Unsupported argument
│
│   on node-pool.tf line 41, in resource "oci_containerengine_node_pool" "oke-node-pool":
│   41:         appir = "primion"
│
│ An argument named "appir" is not expected here.
╵
╷
│ Error: Unsupported argument
│
│   on node-pool.tf line 42, in resource "oci_containerengine_node_pool" "oke-node-pool":
│   42:         envir = "primion-dev"
│
│ An argument named "envir" is not expected here.

### Panic Output

<!--- 
If Terraform produced a panic, please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the output of the `crash.log`. 

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->

### Expected Behavior

<!--- What should have happened? --->
Create the initial labels

### Actual Behavior

<!--- What actually happened? --->
Terraform is failing

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->

1. `terraform plan`

<!--- Is there anything atypical about your environment that we should know? For example: Is the issue specific to a region? --->

issue.title: oci_certificates_management_certificate fails with config_type="IMPORTED"

labels.name: In-Progress
labels.description: Terraform Team is working on the reproduce & fix

issue.body:
<!---
Before filing a bug report, see if your issue is already covered in the [troubleshooting guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html)

Please note the following times when an issue is likely outside of the OCI provider.
This could be either due to issues in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service or the Terraform core.

Examples of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service issues:
* You receive an error with HTTP status code such as 500
* One of your resources timed out while waiting to reach a specific state, even after increasing your operation timeout value

If you are running into one of the above scenarios, we recommend contacting Oracle support at https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/GSG/Tasks/contactingsupport.htm


Examples of Terraform core issues:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues
* [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues

* [Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/) issues
* Spans resources across multiple providers

If you are running into a Terraform core issue, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead.
--->

* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Terraform Version and Provider Version
```
Terraform v1.0.9
on darwin_amd64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/oci v4.50.0
```
<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). 
If you are using a local copy of the Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Provider, run the plugin directly to get the version: `<path-to-plugin>/terraform-provider-oci`
If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->

### Affected Resource(s)

<!--- Please list the affected resources and data sources. For example, "oci_core_vcn". -->
affected_resources = oci_certificates_management_certificate

### Terraform Configuration Files

<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```hcl
resource "oci_certificates_management_certificate" "the_certificate" {
  certificate_config {
    config_type     = "IMPORTED"
    cert_chain_pem  = var.cert_chain_pem
    certificate_pem = var.certificate_pem
    private_key_pem = var.private_key_pem
  }

  compartment_id = var.compartment_id
  name           = var.name
}
```

### Debug Output
```
│ Error: Unsupported argument
│ 
│   on certs.tf line 4, in resource "oci_certificates_management_certificate" "the_certificate":
│    4:     cert_chain_pem = var.cert_chain_pem
│ 
│ An argument named "cert_chain_pem" is not expected here.
╵
╷
│ Error: Unsupported argument
│ 
│   on certs.tf line 5, in resource "oci_certificates_management_certificate" "the_certificate":
│    5:     certificate_pem = var.certificate_pem
│ 
│ An argument named "certificate_pem" is not expected here.
╵
╷
│ Error: Unsupported argument
│ 
│   on certs.tf line 6, in resource "oci_certificates_management_certificate" "the_certificate":
│    6:     private_key_pem = var.private_key_pem
│ 
│ An argument named "private_key_pem" is not expected here.
```
<!---
Please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the complete debug output. Please do NOT paste the debug output in the issue; just paste a link to the Gist.

To obtain the debug output, see the [Verbose logging for OCI Terraform Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html#verbose-logging-for-oci-terraform-provider).

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->

### Panic Output

<!--- 
If Terraform produced a panic, please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the output of the `crash.log`. 

Github Gist: https://gist.github.com/
--->

### Expected Behavior
* I expect IMPORTED certificate script to process properly and create a certificate resource
<!--- What should have happened? --->

### Actual Behavior
* Certificate with `config_type="IMPORTED"` throws error as shown above
<!--- What actually happened? --->

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->

1. `terraform plan`

### Important Factoids

<!--- Is there anything atypical about your environment that we should know? For example: Is the issue specific to a region? --->

### References
* Certificates IMPORT API doc
    https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/api/#/en/certificatesmgmt/20210224/datatypes/CreateCertificateByImportingConfigDetails

<!---
Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests

Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor documentation? For example:
--->

comment.body:
Here's a link to my fork of the OCI Terraform provider with a modified `oci_certificates_management_certificate` resource allows `config_type = "IMPORTED"`, and will actually upload the certificate to OCI Certificate Manager. I have not had a chance to check the Update method, but initial creation works correctly.

https://github.com/bscarbrough/terraform-provider-oci/tree/master

issue.title: oci_sch_service_connector doesn't have the correct terraform plan validation

labels.name: In-Progress
labels.description: Terraform Team is working on the reproduce & fix

issue.body:
<!---
Before filing a bug report, see if your issue is already covered in the [troubleshooting guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html)

Please note the following times when an issue is likely outside of the OCI provider.
This could be either due to issues in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service or the Terraform core.

Examples of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service issues:
* You receive an error with HTTP status code such as 500
* One of your resources timed out while waiting to reach a specific state, even after increasing your operation timeout value

If you are running into one of the above scenarios, we recommend contacting Oracle support at https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/GSG/Tasks/contactingsupport.htm


Examples of Terraform core issues:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues
* [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues
* [Provisioner](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/index.html) issues
* [Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/) issues
* Spans resources across multiple providers

If you are running into a Terraform core issue, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead.
--->

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Terraform Version and Provider Version

<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). 
If you are using a local copy of the Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Provider, run the plugin directly to get the version: `<path-to-plugin>/terraform-provider-oci`
If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->
Terraform v1.4.5
on linux_amd64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/oracle/oci v5.0.0

### Affected Resource(s)

<!--- Please list the affected resources and data sources. For example, "oci_core_vcn". --->
oci_sch_service_connector

### Terraform Configuration Files

<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```hcl
# Copy-paste your Terraform configurations here - for large Terraform configs,
# please use a service like Dropbox and share a link to the ZIP file. 
# Please remove any sensitive information from configuration files before sharing them. 

resource "oci_sch_service_connector" "this" {
  compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaatwvfjx7dfasderwrwrwerwerwer"
  display_name   = "test-service-connector"
  description    = "test service connector"

  source {
    kind = "monitoring"

    stream_id = "ocid1.stream.oc1.ca-toronto-1.amaaaaaa5xeuumqawmp2mlv4tb6rwererwerweera"

    cursor {
      kind = "LATEST"
    }

    monitoring_sources {
      compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaatwvfjx7ymhpzupfnc5fub3erwtgfgwrtwrwr"

      namespace_details {
        kind = "selected"

        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_logging"
        }
        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_objectstorage"
        }
      }
    }

    monitoring_sources {
      compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaaui5npqsoh4mqtvtwaj242rewr242rgey4534536456"

      namespace_details {
        kind = "selected"

        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_compute"
        }
        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_autonomous_database"
        }
      }
    }
  }

  target {
    kind           = "objectStorage"
    bucket         = "bucket-20230612-4235"
    compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaatwvfjx7ymhpzupfnc5fub3xu2fdxkw32434353454rtg"
  }
}
```

### Expected Behavior

<!--- What should have happened? --->
Since one service connector only supports one source type, the source to be created is determined by the source kind variable value, steaming, logging or monitoring. Terraform plan should validation the condition and show only the source type will be created, but NOT the ones will not be created. In the example above, since source kind is "monitoring", only the monitoring source will be created, streaming source will be ignored. As a result, when running terraform plan, it should only show monitoring source will be created, not streaming source.

### Actual Behavior

<!--- What actually happened? --->

When running terraform plan, it shows both streaming and monitoring source will be created which is incorrect and impossible. terraform apply does work correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->

1. use the example above, set the source kind to one of the supported types. in the code, you can also add the logging block as well.
2. run terraform plan. this will show all the source types, as long as they are in the code will be created regardless which source type is set to. in the example above, it INCORRECTLY shows both streaming and monitoring sources will be created. If adding logging source, I believe it will show up as well in the plan.
3. terraform apply does work correctly based on the source type setting which is NOT the problem reported here.

### Important Factoids

<!--- Is there anything atypical about your environment that we should know? For example: Is the issue specific to a region? --->

### References

<!---
Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests

Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor documentation? For example:
--->

comment.body:
Thank you for reporting this issue. We have opened the internal tracking ticket to consider this.
We will keep updating the ticket with the timelines.

labels.name: In-Progress
labels.description: Terraform Team is working on the reproduce & fix

issue.body:
<!---
Before filing a bug report, see if your issue is already covered in the [troubleshooting guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/oci/guides/troubleshooting.html)

Please note the following times when an issue is likely outside of the OCI provider.
This could be either due to issues in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service or the Terraform core.

Examples of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service issues:
* You receive an error with HTTP status code such as 500
* One of your resources timed out while waiting to reach a specific state, even after increasing your operation timeout value

If you are running into one of the above scenarios, we recommend contacting Oracle support at https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/GSG/Tasks/contactingsupport.htm


Examples of Terraform core issues:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues
* [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues

If you are running into a Terraform core issue, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead.
--->

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Terraform Version and Provider Version
Terraform v1.4.5
on linux_amd64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/random v3.5.1
+ provider registry.terraform.io/oracle/oci v4.123.0
<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). 
If you are using a local copy of the Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Provider, run the plugin directly to get the version: `<path-to-plugin>/terraform-provider-oci`
If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->

### Affected Resource(s)

<!--- Please list the affected resources and data sources. For example, "oci_core_vcn". --->
oci_sch_service_connector

### Terraform Configuration Files

<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```hcl
variable "kind" {
  type        = string
  default     = "monitoring"
}

resource "oci_sch_service_connector" "this" {
  compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaatwvfjx7ymhpzupfnc5fub3xu2fdxkweamwtrpadsfaer2er23r"
  display_name   = "test-service-connector"
  description    = "test service connector"

  source {
    kind = var.kind

    stream_id = var.kind == "streaming" ? "ocid1.stream.oc1.ca-toronto-1.amaaaaaa5xeuumqawmp2mlv4tb63hy3rxi6qs7kbinopcladsr3223ew" : null

    dynamic "cursor" {
      for_each = var.kind == "streaming" ? [1] : []
      content {
        kind = "LATEST"
      }
    }

    dynamic "monitoring_sources" {
      for_each = var.kind == "monitoring" ? [1] : []
      content {
        compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaatwvfjx7ymhpzupfnc5fub3xu2fdxkweamwtrpa3crdrwosnwworq"

        namespace_details {
          kind = "selected"

          namespaces {
            metrics {
              kind = "all"
            }
            namespace = "oci_logging"
          }
          namespaces {
            metrics {
              kind = "all"
            }
            namespace = "oci_objectstorage"
          }
        }
      }
    }

    monitoring_sources {
      compartment_id = "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaaui5npqsoh4mqtvtwaj242sdlwgdaser2r2424t435"

      namespace_details {
        kind = "selected"

        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_compute"
        }
        namespaces {
          metrics {
            kind = "all"
          }
          namespace = "oci_autonomous_database"
        }
      }
    }
  }

  target {
    kind           = "objectStorage"
    bucket         = "testbucket123"
    enable_formatted_messaging = true
  }
}
```
### Expected Behavior

<!--- What should have happened? --->
terraform plan should show exactly what will be created/changed when doing terraform apply

### Actual Behavior

<!--- What actually happened? --->

terraform plan output shows many extra settings that will NOT be created at all when doing terraform apply. Even with extra custom conditional, some of the settings were masked(such as dynamic blocks), but some settings are still there, such as stream_id and many more.

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->

1. use the code snippet above (update the OCIDs as needed)
2. terraform plan. Output will show the creation of steaming source, function task etc., even though they are not configured
3. `terraform apply` correctly created the monitoring source related settings.

### Important Factoids

<!--- Is there anything atypical about your environment that we should know? For example: Is the issue specific to a region? --->

### References

<!---
Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests

Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor documentation? For example:
--->

comment.body:
Thank you for reporting this issue. We have opened the internal tracking ticket to consider this.
We will keep updating the ticket with the timelines.

issue.title: OCI Redis Terraform
issue.body:
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

### Description

Addition of new resources to manage Redis clusters in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Cache with Redis. Currently, there is only two data sources available (oci_redis_redis_cluster; oci_redis_redis_clusters).

### New or Affected Resource(s)

resource:  oci_redis_redis_cluster (suggested name)

### Potential Terraform Configuration
```hcl
resource "oci_redis_redis_cluster" "test_redis_cluster" {
  compartment_id = var.compartment_ocid
  display_name = var.redis_cluster_display_name
  node_count = 1
  // or other required configurations for a Redis cluster in OCI.
}
```

### References

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_cluster
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/data-sources/redis_redis_clusters
https://www.oracle.com/cloud/redis/

issue.title: oci_load_balancer_load_balancer_routing_policy - make rules scalable?
issue.body:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/oracle/oci/latest/docs/resources/load_balancer_load_balancer_routing_policy - this code doesn't seem to have any way of making the rules scalable. In other words, we have to always hard code in the rules. we can't put this resource block in a module and re-use it because we would always need to change the rules based on how many rules we have. Its sort of a ridiculous situation and makes the resource very difficult to use. 
Could not this resource be made scalable? or perhaps routing policy rules could be separated into a different resource, similiar to Network Security Groups and their rules?
